questions.q: Which tag is used to create a line break in HTML?
questions.explanation:
The
tag creates a line break in HTML. It's a self-closing tag that forces content to continue on the next line.

questions.q: What does the <hr> tag do in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <hr> tag inserts a horizontal rule (line) across the page, often used to separate content sections or create visual breaks.

questions.q: Which tag is used to preserve the formatting of text in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <pre> tag (preformatted text) preserves both spaces and line breaks exactly as they appear in the code, using a monospace font.

questions.q: Which tag is used to define the structure of an HTML document?
questions.explanation: All three tags are essential for HTML document structure: <html> wraps the entire document, <head> contains metadata, and <body> contains the visible content.

questions.q: What is the purpose of the <head> tag in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <head> section contains metadata about the document, including the title, character encoding, stylesheets, scripts, and other information not directly visible on the page.
options: To define the main content of the document
To contain metadata and other header information

questions.q: Which tag is used to create a paragraph in HTML?
questions.explanation:
The

tag defines a paragraph in HTML. Browsers automatically add spacing before and after paragraph elements.

questions.q: What does the <center> tag do in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <center> tag centers content horizontally on the page. However, this tag is deprecated in HTML5 and CSS should be used instead.

questions.q: Which tag is used to create a horizontal line in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <hr> tag creates a horizontal rule (line) in HTML, serving as a thematic break or visual separator between content sections.

questions.q: Which attribute is used to uniquely identify an HTML element?
questions.explanation: The 'id' attribute provides a unique identifier for an HTML element. Each id must be unique within a page and can be used for CSS styling, JavaScript manipulation, or creating anchor links.

questions.q: What is the purpose of the title attribute in HTML?
questions.explanation: The 'title' attribute provides supplementary information about an element. When users hover over the element, this information is typically displayed as a tooltip.
options: To define the title of the document
To provide additional information about an element, often displayed as a tooltip

questions.q: Which attribute is used to define inline styles in HTML?
questions.explanation: The 'style' attribute allows you to apply CSS styles directly to an HTML element inline, though external stylesheets are generally preferred for better maintainability.

questions.q: What does the lang attribute in HTML specify?
questions.explanation: The 'lang' attribute specifies the language of the element's content, helping browsers, search engines, and assistive technologies properly handle the content.

questions.q: The <title> tag is used to define the title of an HTML document.
questions.explanation: True. The <title> tag, placed in the <head> section, defines the document's title that appears in the browser tab and search results.

questions.q: The <h1> tag is used for the smallest heading in HTML.
questions.explanation: False. The <h1> tag creates the largest heading. Headings range from <h1> (largest and most important) to <h6> (smallest).

questions.q: The <hr> tag is used to create a hyperlink.
questions.explanation: False. The <hr> tag creates a horizontal rule (line), not a hyperlink. Hyperlinks are created with the <a> tag.

questions.q: The <pre> tag is used to preserve the formatting of text in HTML.
questions.explanation: True. The <pre> tag displays text with preserved whitespace and line breaks, exactly as written in the HTML code.

questions.q: The <head> tag contains the main content of an HTML document.
questions.explanation: False. The <head> tag contains metadata and document information. The main visible content is contained in the <body> tag.

questions.q: The <center> tag is used to center content vertically in HTML.
questions.explanation: False. The <center> tag centers content horizontally, not vertically. Note that this tag is deprecated in modern HTML.

questions.q: The <hr> tag inserts a horizontal line in HTML.
questions.explanation: True. The <hr> tag creates a horizontal rule that spans the width of its container, used for visual separation.

questions.q: The <html> tag is optional in an HTML document.
questions.explanation: False. While browsers may render pages without it, the <html> tag is a required part of proper HTML document structure and should always be included.
